title: Gene boundary/termination site detector
description: This feature detects gene boundaries, particularly at the 3' end of genes where there is a transition to a gene oriented in the opposite direction. It shows strong, localized activation spikes at these transition points, suggesting sensitivity to sequence motifs associated with transcriptional termination or gene boundary regions. The precise positioning consistently shows activation at the end of one gene before the start of another running in the opposite direction. This pattern likely represents termination signals, stop codons, or intergenic regions with specific sequence characteristics that mark the boundary between genes. The feature is consistent across diverse bacterial and archaeal genomes, indicating it captures a fundamental genomic organizational element rather than taxon-specific patterns.
